title: Stop saying "this is just a game"
body:
Okay, this may be a rage thread, but this is seriously pissing me off. Let me just give a recent scenario to you guys. I was playing another ranked game and our mid and top were doing quite poorly. The mid fizz was 14-1 by 20 min into the game and top Hec was 10-2. Post game, rather than staying quiet, or acknowledging they just had a bad game (cause legit guys, we all do, even I do sometimes while also having my awesome games too), our mid laner said the most infuriating and tilting words ever:

"It is just a game." 

So that makes it okay to feed? And to rage at teammates? So rather than saying to yourself "I did badly, let me see what I did wrong so I can fix it in the future" you say "Idgaf and I will keep doing my mistakes because this is only a game and it doesn't matter anyway."

Cause here is the thing, this is not just a game. This is a community, a new world. A livelihood for some (LCS pros) and an incredibly important hobby to others (like myself). We can make long lasting friends here. Or we can play on our own to feel that thrill we don't always experience in our normal day to day life. Whether we are Bronze or challenjour, we play this game because we enjoy it and it is not just a select few, but over 70 million of us. 

And yeah, yeah... "You are not an LCS pro lmfao." I know.... don't remind me.... but even LCS pros had to start somewhere. They didn't all of a sudden get placed into Diamond 1 and they don't all play perfectly all the time either. And to them, a win or a loss still has a lot of meaning to them, just like it does to many of us. 

So please, don't let "this is just a game" be an excuse to keep playing poorly in a ranked match and an excuse to not learn from it. If you don't want to learn or get better, then stay out of ranked. If you plan to go into ranked not caring if you win or lose, then stay out of ranked. That is what is normals is for. 

Courtesy of an avid League of Legends Player,


Airman CompSci

replies.body: And that is completely correct. You are allowed to have bad games, to have negative score because well- its just a game.

I think the issue is more that people won't even acknowledge they're doing poorly and don't try to adjust, while also blaming others for why they're failing. We're playing this game to have fun, but when people are not trying to win it ruins the experience for everyone involved. There's a difference between a negative score and blatant feeding.

Well, I was never raging the person. In fact, because of how important this game is to me, I have made myself control my anger and such since I know flaming only makes my teammates play worse. I try to be supportive and generous. And when I have a bad game, I always admit at the end (or even during the game) that I made a mistake and "this" is what I could have done better. Rather than not giving a fuck about it.

I can understand this sort of behavior in normals where people can legit chill, but in ranked its go time. That is why I don't bother anyone in normals about it, what so ever (just like I don't care about when people try to surrender in normals).
Well then, all i can really say is I love your attitude {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

I tend to think most people who say things like "it's just a game" are using it as a different way to say chill out rather than it being some declaration that they aren't trying to win. It is something people say when they get defensive to try and defuse tension. It is a statement about someone else's attitude in the game, not their own.

That said, it is a counter productive thing to say. People do not chill out when they are agitated when someone says so.

So while for me, being serious is fun, for others, trolling is as equally amusing. I will give them normals to do that, but ranked I must say it is off limits for any type of foul play toward your own team. It is go time. Some of us truly do want to try to climb in the ranks as high as we can.
